title: Adaptation of the OurCareWishes.Org ACP Platform for Persons With Dementia in NHs and Their Caregivers
description_brief: This Our Care Wishes- Dementia pilot study is adapting an existing successful online advance care planning platform to the specific needs of persons living with dementia and shared decision-makers (SDMs) and testing the usability and acceptability among nursing home residents and SDMs.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails:
Enrolled participants are organized into 4 individual groups: PLWDs \& SDMs in the intervention and control arms. Dyads in all study arms who stopped answering study team calls after initial verbal telephone consent and did not complete the baseline interview were not considered enrolled and are excluded from the "Baseline \& Follow Up Surveys" period below.

Demographics were collected during the baseline interview.

Nursing home staff were not enrolled in the study.
participantFlowModule.recruitmentDetails: Dyads (i.e., persons living with dementia (PLWD) and their shared decision-makers (SDMS) were initially recruited by nursing home staff. Then, study staff read an assent script to and reviewed study procedures with interested SDMs. SDMs who agreed to participate were sent a copy of the study summary and assent script. After verbal assent was acquired, dyads (PLWDs and SDMs) were assigned to the intervention group or control arm.

groups.title: PLWD: Control
groups.description:
Participants living with dementia randomized to the control group will receive usual advanced care planning help from nursing facility staff and will not complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website.

Participants will complete surveys that capture confidence in decision-making at baseline and 1 week. Participants will complete these surveys alongside their shared decision makers.

groups.title: SDMs: Control
groups.description:
Shared decision-makers of persons living with dementia randomized to the control group will work with their care receiver to have usual advanced care planning discussions with nursing facility staff. SDMs in the control group will not complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website.

SDMs will complete surveys that capture confidence in decision-making at baseline and 1 week. SDMs will complete these surveys alongside the nursing home resident they care for.

groups.title: PLWD: Intervention
groups.description:
Persons living with dementia (PLWD) randomized to the intervention group will complete a baseline interview alongside their shared decision-maker (SDM) that collects demographics and their confidence in decision-making.

Then PLWDs will work with their SDM to complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website with the PLWD. Our Memory Care Wishes is a web-based advance care planning platform designed for persons living with dementia in nursing homes to discuss and document healthcare and daily life preferences with the help of shared decision-makers.

1 week after completing the website, PLWDs will complete a follow up interview collecting their confidence in decision-making, ratings of the website and how COVID has affected their decision-making.

groups.title: SDMs: Intervention
groups.description:
Shared decision-makers (SDMs) of persons living with dementia (PLWD) randomized to the intervention group will complete a baseline interview that collects demographics and their confidence in decision-making when it comes to being a surrogate for the PLWD.

Then, SDMs will complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website with the PLWD. Our Memory Care Wishes is a web-based advance care planning platform designed for persons living with dementia in nursing homes to discuss and document healthcare and daily life preferences with the help of shared decision-makers.

1 week after completing the website, SDMs will complete a follow up interview collecting their confidence in decision-making, ratings of the website and how COVID has affected their decision-making.

milestones.comment: After initial verbal screening and randomization, 4 dyads did not participant in the study. These dyads stopped answering calls after initial verbal consent.

baselineCharacteristicsModule.populationDescription: PLWDs and their SDMs in control and intervention study arms met with study staff and nursing home staff to complete baseline interviews. At baseline, demographics and confidence levels in decision-making were collected for both SDMs and PLWDs.

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Adapted Decision Making Confidence Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Items from the Surrogate Decision-Making Confidence Scale and 9-item ACP Engagement Survey were used and adapted to capture the confidence in advanced care planning decision-making from both persons living with dementia and their shared decision-maker' points of view. The scale utilizes a Likert scale with values ranging from 1 (not confident at all) to 5 (very confident).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: SDMs and PLWDs in all study arms that completed the baseline interview were analyzed.

groups.title: PLWD: Control
groups.description:
Participants living with dementia randomized to the control group will receive usual advanced care planning help from nursing facility staff and will not complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website.

Participants will complete surveys that capture confidence in decision-making at baseline and 1 week. Participants will complete these surveys alongside their shared decision makers.

groups.description:

groups.title: PLWDs: Intervention
groups.description:
Persons living with dementia (PLWD) randomized to the intervention group will complete a baseline interview alongside their shared decision-maker (SDM) that collects demographics and their confidence in decision-making.

Then PLWDs will work with their SDM to complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website with the PLWD. Our Memory Care Wishes is a web-based advance care planning platform designed for persons living with dementia in nursing homes to discuss and document healthcare and daily life preferences with the help of shared decision-makers.

Our Memory Care Wishes: Our Memory Care Wishes is a web-based advance care planning platform designed for persons living with dementia in nursing homes to discuss and document healthcare and daily life preferences with the help of shared decision-makers. Penn researchers meet via Zoom with PLWD and their SDMS and nursing home staff to facilitate website completion.

Our Memory Care Wishes is a web-based advance care planning platform designed for persons living with dementia in nursing homes to discuss and document healthcare and daily life preferences with the help of shared decision-makers.

1 week after completing the website, SDMs will complete a follow up interview collecting their confidence in decision-making, ratings of the website and how COVID has affected their decision-making.

outcomeMeasures.title: Post Adapted Decision Making Confidence Scale
outcomeMeasures.description: Items from the Surrogate Decision-Making Confidence Scale and 9-item ACP Engagement Survey were used and adapted to capture the confidence in advanced care planning decision-making from both persons living with dementia and their shared decision-maker' points of view. The scale utilizes a Likert scale with values ranging from 1 (not confident at all) to 5 (very confident). This is the second time point the measure was collected.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: 1 PLWD from the control group and 1 SDM from the Intervention group were lost to follow up. Data was not collected at this timepoint and so were not analyzed.

outcomeMeasures.title: Website Ease of Use
outcomeMeasures.description: This scale measures the ease of use of the website. This scale uses a Likert scale from 0 (very hard) to 10 (very easy). These data were collected from PLWDs and SDMs in the intervention group.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: SDMs tended to navigate the website and use the website to facilitate advanced care planning discussions with PLWDs. PLWDs participated in conversations about advanced care planning decisions but often did not actively use the website and so were not always able to answer or understand the questions regarding the website. In the end, only one PLWD from the intervention group was able to answer the questions about the website's ease of use. Thus, the score below indicates that PLWD's rating.

outcomeMeasures.title: Rate of ACP Website Completion - Time
outcomeMeasures.description: This tool measured total time spent by participants on the advance care planning website. Total time in minutes spent on the website were collected. Because SDMs navigated the website with the PLWD alongside them, this measure was only used to SDMs in the intervention group.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Total time SDMs spent navigating the Our Memory Care Wishes website was captured for each SDM in the intervention group.

groups.title: SDMs: Intervention
groups.description:
Shared decision-makers (SDMs) of persons living with dementia (PLWD) randomized to the intervention group will complete a baseline interview that collects demographics and their confidence in decision-making when it comes to being a surrogate for the PLWD.

Then, SDMs will complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website with the PLWD. Our Memory Care Wishes is a web-based advance care planning platform designed for persons living with dementia in nursing homes to discuss and document healthcare and daily life preferences with the help of shared decision-makers.

1 week after completing the website, SDMs will complete a follow up interview collecting their confidence in decision-making, ratings of the website and how COVID has affected their decision-making.

outcomeMeasures.title: Rate of ACP Website Completion - Questions Completed
outcomeMeasures.description: This tool measured what percentage of the website was completed by participants. Because SDMs navigated the website with the PLWD alongside them, this measure was only associated with SDMs in the intervention group.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Percentage of website completed was captured for SDMs as they were primary navigators of the website.

groups.title: SDMs: Intervention

1 week after completing the website, SDMs will complete a follow up interview collecting their confidence in decision-making, ratings of the website and how COVID has affected their decision-making.

outcomeMeasures.title: COVID-19 Impact Questionnaire
outcomeMeasures.description:
Participants were asked if their healthcare preferences changed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Items included:

1. Since COVID, planning for the future is: (1) less important (2) more important, or (3) the same
2. Since COVID, the sense of urgency to name a supportive decision maker has: (1) increased (2) decreased, or (3) remained the same.
3. Since COVID, my preferences for decisions about breathing machines (ventilators) have: (1) changed or (2) remained the same.
4. Since COVID, my preferences for going to the hospital for care versus receiving treatment in place have:(1) changed, or (2) remained the same.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription:
1 PLWD in the control group was lost to follow up.

1 SDM in the control group was lost to follow up.

1 PLWD in the intervention group was lost to follow up.

1 SMD in the intervention group was lost to follow up.

classes.title: Participants who reported a change in importance level for planning for the future since COVID-19.
Change in the sense of urgency to name a supportive decision maker since COVID-19
Participants who reported a change in breathing machine preferences since COVID-19.
Participants whose preferences for going to the hospital for care versus receiving treatment changed

adverseEventsModule.description: 14 out of 14 participants analyzed. No adverse events occured.

eventGroups.title: Control
eventGroups.description: Participants randomized to the control group will receive usual advanced care planning help from nursing facility staff and will not complete the Our Memory Care Wishes website. Participants will complete surveys that capture confidence in decision-making at baseline and 1 week.

eventGroups.title: Intervention
eventGroups.description: Our Memory Care Wishes: Our Memory Care Wishes is a web-based advance care planning platform designed for persons living with dementia in nursing homes to discuss and document healthcare and daily life preferences with the help of shared decision-makers. Penn researchers meet via Zoom with PLWD and their SDMS and nursing home staff to facilitate website completion.

pointOfContact.title: Emily Summerhayes
pointOfContact.organization: The University of Pennsylvania School of Nursing

explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is an adapted online advance care planning (ACP) platform (branded Our Memory Care Wishes) intended to improve usability and acceptability of ACP for persons living with dementia and their shared decision-makers in nursing homes — this is a behavioral/decision-support intervention, not a drug or biologic. citeturn0search1turn0search5

Act (extracted details): Trial registration NCT05033262 (Our Care Wishes - Dementia) lists the intervention as “Our Memory Care Wishes,” a web‑based ACP platform adapted from OurCareWishes.org and tested for usability/acceptability among nursing home residents and SDMs; lead sponsor University of Pennsylvania; study type interventional but non‑pharmacologic. citeturn0search1turn0search5

Supporting evidence/publication: A published feasibility/acceptability study describing the adaptation (Our Memory Care Wishes) and findings about ease of use, helpfulness for planning, and modifications for persons living with dementia confirms the intervention is a web decision aid for advance care planning rather than a therapeutic drug. citeturn0search3turn0search0

Reflect: Given the intervention is a digital advance care planning tool (no drug, biologic, or cognitive‑enhancing pharmacologic agent, and no trial aim to modify Alzheimer pathology or to treat neuropsychiatric symptoms), it does not match any of the four therapeutic categories and should be classified as 'N/A'. There is no drug or placebo listed in the trial registration or publications. citeturn0search1turn0search3
